topic.title: The difference between democracy and dictatorship
topic.body:
What is the difference between democracy and dictatorship?


In a dictatorship 1 psychopath decides what millions of sheeps are allowed to do, and what not


In democracy, 500 psychopaths first speak with each other, and tell millions of sheep what they are allowed to do, and what not.

1563459417_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: what about letting someone else buy Monero for you and then exchange it to Bitcoin on xmr.to ?

> [xcape2net](#comment_119_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Too inconvenient.  Also, "someone else" can then identify you.

Very convenient. That way you get your coins almost instantly without having them associated to you. Also "Someone" can be a close family member or the best friend. Without having anyone you can trust you probably cannot make this convenient.

> [redlibertyreal](#comment_28_1D6UcmziWg55aXV6TnCksXpjsFJ4gDK6Kw): Use Bisq and/or buy BTC with XMR. I really don't like BTC for this reason, cryptocurrencies should be privacy respecting (anonymous) by default. This is why I prefer XMR to BTC. I'm not a right-libertarian but I nonetheless still, even as a leftist, very much appreciate the social necessity of such market technologies. BTC in my mind is just stupid. If it's not respecting your privacy you simply shouldn't use it. It doesn't matter if you "have nothing to hide" or if you are "doing nothing wrong", it's a matter of principle.

Monero should be at least used to enter (fiat->crypto) and exit (crypto->fiat)
